attributes.action: Detox programmes for alcoholics are often not cost effective due to its high regression rate, except for those with genuine aversion towards alcohol
attributes.additional_details: Feelings of the pleasures of drinking alcohol (heavily, moderately or occasionally) would depend on one's motivation, triggers, settings, lifestyle, perception, cravings and aims. If a recovering alcoholic have a genuine aversion to alcohol in his or her own mind, than it is certain that he or she is no longer a recovering alcoholic but a recovered one. Otherwise, rehabilitation & detox programmes for alcoholics are often not cost effective due to its high regression rate.
